description: {"blocks":[{"key":"c5c3u","text":"Citrobacter rodentium is a Gram-negative bacterium which infects laboratory mice in a similar way to how enteropathogenic Escherichia coli (EPEC) and enterohaemorrhagic E. coli (EHEC) infect humans. As a gastrointestinal pathogen, C. rodentium is shed in the stools of infected animals. This allows in vivo infection dynamics to be monitored by plating out the bacteria present in shed stools. We routinely use a bioluminescent derivative of C. rodentium called ICC180 which contains the lux operon from Photorhabdus luminescens. This allows us to monitor infection dynamics using luminometry too.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":22},{"style":"italic","offset":122,"length":17},{"style":"italic","offset":169,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":231,"length":12},{"style":"italic","offset":442,"length":12},{"style":"italic","offset":504,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0sa6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8d00g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"3b2bm","text":"Experiments involving animals and pathogenic bacteria require ethical and biological safety approval. When planning experiments involving animals, consult the PREPARE and ARRIVE guidelines.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":159,"length":7},{"key":1,"offset":171,"length":6}],"data":{}},{"key":"qhhp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"72cog","text":"Luminometry: Luminometers measure light emission using photomultiplier tubes, which convert photons into electrical pulses. Luminometers come in many formats, from a simple manual one-tube luminometer to a computer-controlled micro-titre plate instrument. Detected photons are often displayed as relative light units (RLU) or counts per second. Absolute values of light emission vary greatly from luminometer to luminometer for a given amount of luciferase protein. For this reason, samples from an experiment should be run on the same machine using the same protocol. Also note, when using micro-titre plate instruments, light can spill over from wells containing bright samples to the surrounding wells if using white or clear plates. We routinely use black plates to minimise such spill over.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E5F89A83CFDA11EC848C0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://norecopa.no/prepare/prepare-checklist"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E5F89AF9CFDA11EC848C0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://arriveguidelines.org/"}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7pppu","text":"Place each mouse in a clean pipette tip box which has had the insert removed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7f46c","text":"Once a mouse has produced 1-3 individual stools, transfer these to a sterile labelled microfuge tube of known weight using a pair of clean tweezers. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a2cm1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c6qfk","text":"Depending on the mouse strain, stools can become very loose and much more difficult to pick up using tweezers. In these instances, try using a small laboratory spatula instead. {"blocks":[{"key":"bf29v","text":"Transfer the mouse back to its home cage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"beo7c","text":"Clean the pipette tip box and tweezers using an approved disinfectant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
